page.title: 01STOKE GOLDING AND THE FENNS
page.content: Mixed farms spread evenly across the flat, drained countryside. Fields, crossed by a network of streams, are divided by hedges with occasional small deciduous woodlands planted for the use of the Atherstone Hunt. In the north eastern corner development of the Bosworth Battlefield includes new footpathsm a nature reserve along a disused railway and horse-drawn barge trips. To the south west Stoke Golding stands on rising ground, the Ashby Canal winding around its outskirts. Most villaes commute but some find work at three small textile factories and an electronics factory in the village. Other sources of wmployment are the butchers and abattoir, a hairdressers and seasonal canal boat hire business. Craftsmen include a builder, carpenter, painter and decorator and a signwriter.
